## Week 3 quiz common mistakes I {style="font-size: 0.9em"}
* First pass at grading done, but not ready to release. So far, grades look better than week 2's quiz.

1. Say you were interested in the average income in each ZIP code. Make a plot showing this in Altair. Specify the data type(s) being plotted (N/O/Q/T). 

    > `alt.X("zip_code:N"), alt.Y("mean(income_usd):Q"` ratio

    > Common mistakes: not showing the chart (chart should be last line or include `display(chart)`)


## Week 3 quiz common mistakes II {style="font-size: 0.9em"}

2. Assume the Federal Poverty Line (FPL) is $15650. Say you were interested in how far each age bracket is on average from the FPL. Make a plot in Altair. Specify the data type(s) being plotted(N/O/Q/T). 

    > `df["diff_to_FPL"] = df["income_usd"] - poverty_line; alt.X("age:O") alt.Y("mean(diff_to_FPL):Q"` interval

    > Common mistakes: not calculating distance to FPL, age as `N`
